channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Meme Battle: Judging Olympians
item.description: We'll pick a new memelord for next week's Sunday Edition and provide you with another meme template to meme-ify.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg Wants Facebook to Become a Metaverse Company. But What Does He Mean By That?
item.description: “In the coming years, I expect people will transition from seeing us primarily as a social media company to seeing us as a metaverse company,” he said on Facebook’s earnings call Wednesday.  The backstory: The term “metaverse” first showed up in Neal Stephenson’s sci-fi novel Snow Crash in 1992, and was built upon by other science fiction thinkers like Ernest Cline, who depicted a version of the metaverse in his book Ready Player One. Metaverse philosophizing picked up during the pandemic, when people started hanging out in video games like Fortnite, Roblox, and Animal Crossing instead of IRL. The metaverse will be a fully functioning economy, so you can buy, sell, and invest in things as you would in the physical world. But what is the metaverse?    And yet the metaverse is so tantalizing, so esoteric, that it could mean everything...
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: After A Drop in Demand, Mask Sales Rebound
item.description: Analysts expect mask sales to jump even more after the CDC issued new guidance that encourages vaccinated people to wear masks indoors in Covid hotspots.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Scarlett Johansson Sues Disney for ‘Black Widow’ Streaming Release
item.description: But Black Widow made a lot of money outside of theaters—$60 million from Disney+. Big picture: Companies like Disney have thrown tens of billions into the streaming wars. Black Widow earned $80 million at its opening weekend at the box office, a record for pandemic times, but not great for a Marvel movie.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: US Economy Surges to Pre-Pandemic Levels, but Comes in Lower Than Forecasts
item.description: What’s not working Supply chain snags: Apple and Tesla this week joined the chorus of companies warning that the chip shortage was hurting their businesses. But in general, he thinks with high vaccination rates the “effects will probably be less.  If that’s the parade, here’s a little rain: The 6.5% annual growth rate last quarter fell below forecasts, showing there are still some mustard stains on the economy’s T-shirt.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: What’s not working Supply chain snags: Apple and Tesla this week joined the chorus of companies warning that the chip shortage was hurting their businesses. But in general, he thinks with high vaccination rates the “effects will probably be less.  If that’s the parade, here’s a little rain: The 6.5% annual growth rate last quarter fell below forecasts, showing there are still some mustard stains on the economy’s T-shirt.

item.title: Scarlett Johansson Sues Disney for ‘Black Widow’ Streaming Release
item.description: In an unprecedented move, Disney also announced that Black Widow made $60 million from Disney+. The backstory: Earlier this month, Disney released the movie in theaters and on its streaming service Disney+ for an additional $30. Black Widow earned $80 million at its opening weekend at the box office, a record for pandemic times, but not great for a Marvel movie.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: After A Drop in Demand, Mask Sales Rebound
item.description: Analysts expect mask sales to jump even more after the CDC issued new guidance that encourages vaccinated people to wear masks indoors in Covid hotspots.   After a drop in demand, masks are making a comeback: Masks, which had accounted for 14% of gross merchandise sales on Etsy in Q2 2020, fell to a 3% share in Q1 this year.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: The Most 2021 Headline Is About BTS and Chicken Sandwiches
item.description: Drive-thru times increased by three seconds due to the labor shortage, but CEO Chris Kempczinski said more job applications were flowing in and that dining rooms should be 100% open by Labor Day.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 29
item.description: (The Atlantic)  Read: Why is so much American bureaucracy left to average citizens? and why they [bleeping] hated it. One Reddit user wrote about going back to the office for the first time since the pandemic started...
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Pfizer Expects Covid Vaccine to Bring in $33.5 Billion This Year
item.description: The drugmaker projected that Covid-19 vaccine sales would hit $33.5 billion this year, a 29% bump from previous estimates. The US recently paid $24/dose for an order of 200 million doses, up from the $19.50/dose it paid Pfizer for previous orders. Moderna will report its earnings Aug. 5.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: The Bull and Bear Case for Robinhood’s IPO
item.description: Trading app Robinhood is set to IPO this morning under the ticker symbol HOOD in one of the most unusual public offerings ever. As for regulatory scrutiny, Robinhood says it has room to grow into far less sketchy spaces, like retirement accounts. Are you going to invest?
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: The Delta Variant Puts The Breaks on Return to Office
item.description: In its announcement yesterday, Google said that anyone coming into the office would need to be vaccinated.  Google's one of a number of companies rethinking their workplace plans due to the—okay fine we’ll go there—fourth wave of Covid-19. Google employees hung up their business hoodies and put on their home hoodies after CEO Sundar Pichai postponed the company’s return to the office by a month-and-a-half, to mid-October. The Ultas, Sweetgreens, and transit systems of the world are counting on you to spend money during the workday like you did in 2019.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: The Bull and Bear Case for Robinhood’s IPO
item.description: Trading app Robinhood is set to IPO this morning under the ticker symbol HOOD in the most meta public offering ever. As for regulatory scrutiny, Robinhood says it has room to grow into far less sketchy spaces, like retirement accounts. The fast-growing company paved the way for Average Joe traders to feel like Ferragamo-wearing Wall Streeters.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Pfizer Expects Covid Vaccine to Bring in $33.5 Billion This Year
item.description: The drugmaker projected that Covid-19 vaccine sales would hit $33.5 billion in revenue this year, a 29% bump from previous estimates. The US recently paid $24/dose for an order of 200 million doses, up from the $19.50/dose it paid Pfizer for previous orders. Moderna will report its earnings Aug. 5.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: The Delta Variant Puts The Breaks on Return to Office
item.description: In its postponement announcement, Google said that anyone coming into the office would need to be vaccinated. Google employees hung up their business hoodies and put on their home hoodies after CEO Sundar Pichai postponed the company’s return to the office by a month-and-a-half, to mid-October. Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, Wells Fargo, and United Airlines have all made similar moves. The Ultas, Sweetgreens, and transit systems of the world are counting on you to spend money during the workday like you did in 2019.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Big Tech Companies Crush Earnings
item.description: CEO Satya Nadella said the words “enterprise metaverse” on the earnings call and not even he knew what it meant.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Simone Biles Withdraws From Team Finals to Take Care of Her Mental Health
item.description: Simone Biles, US Olympic gymnastics team member and the greatest gymnast of all time, pulled out of the team finals in Tokyo yesterday to focus on her mental health. It’s also the first time Team USA is traveling with a group of mental health experts in addition to dedicated psychologists for each sport.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: CDC Advises Vaccinated People to Resume Wearing Masks Indoors
item.description: The details: The CDC advised everyone at K-12 schools and those living in Covid hotspots to wear masks in indoor settings. There’s no clear answer as, "The Delta variant is showing everyday its willingness to outsmart us and be an opportunist,” CDC Director Dr. Rochelle Walensky said. Consult this map from the CDC.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Influencer Marketing Spending to Pass $3 Billion This Year
item.description: And if there’s any time to be hawking trendy electronics from your social account, it’s right now, because influencer marketing spending is expected to grow 30% this year to top $3 billion, per eMarketer.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 28
item.description: (NPR) Read: Who will pay to protect tech giants from rising seas? Employees are staging a walkout today to demand changes in the ways women and other marginalized groups are treated at the company.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Extra Unemployment Benefits Kept Some Workers on the Sidelines but Did Not Reduce Overall Employment, Report Says
item.description: Economists are scrambling to figure it out, and yesterday we got a preliminary answer that’s just as nuanced as the question: Extra unemployment insurance (UI) didn’t impact overall job growth, but it did cause a reshuffling of the type of people who were working. The takeawaysIn states that ended extra UI early, hiring for adult workers 25 or older increased the week governors said they were cutting benefits, but returned to typical levels once the benefits actually expired. At the same time, the hiring of teenagers 15–19 jumped in states that didn’t cut the extra benefits.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Checking in on the 'Jeopardy' Hosting Tryouts
item.description: If you answered LeVar Burton you'd be wrong.  Zoom out: Jeopardy!   When Burton made it known he really wanted the gig, fans started a petition that garnered over 250,000 signatures, which caught the eye of the show’s producers. Finding the right host is one of the most crucial decisions facing television execs today. But viewership is down 10% in the post-Trebek world.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 27
item.description: But here’s the funny part—Man Group trades crypto for its clients, because, hey, you can make money. (The Secret Life of Machines) Watch: Fax machines are more clever than you might think.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: China Cracks Down on After-school Tutoring Sector
item.description: The government’s announcement gave the burning-hot industry an ice bath:New Oriental, one of China’s biggest private education companies, has plunged nearly 70% since last Thursday. Why it matters: China’s education technology sector has ballooned to $100 billion, with about 70% of K-12 students enrolled in after-school tutoring programs in major cities.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Tesla Scored Record Profits, Revenue, and Deliveries in Q2
item.description: The company reported a $23 million “impairment” related to its bitcoin holdings. Sales of electric vehicles in the US more than doubled in the first half of 2021 compared to last year.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Covid Vaccine Mandates Gaining Traction
item.description: The Department of Veterans Affairs became the first federal agency to require Covid-19 vaccines for its 115,000 healthcare employees yesterday. American Mandate AssociationEven before those announcements, 57 influential medical groups published a letter urging employers to require Covid vaccines for all healthcare personnel. The White House has no plans to introduce vaccine mandates or passports, so it’s been up to cities, states, and private companies to set vaccine requirements. Covid cases in the city have grown to 800+ per day.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Tesla Scored Record Profits, Revenue, and Deliveries in Q2
item.description: . Sales of electric vehicles in the US more than doubled in the first half of 2021 compared to last year. The company reported a $23 million “impairment” related to its bitcoin holdings.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: China Cracks Down on After-school Tutoring Sector
item.description: The government’s announcement gave the burning-hot industry an ice bath:New Oriental, one of China’s biggest private education companies, has plunged nearly 70% since last Thursday. For all you students who’ve complained about after-school tutoring, the Chinese government agrees with you.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Covid Vaccine Mandates Gaining Traction
item.description: American Mandate AssociationEven before those announcements, 57 influential medical groups published a letter urging employers to require Covid vaccines for all healthcare personnel. Vaccine mandates came in fast and furious yesterday as New York City, California, and the Department of Veterans Affairs introduced a choice for employees: join the Mod(erna) Squad or get a weekly Covid test. The White House has no plans to impose vaccine mandates or passports, so it’s been up to cities, states, and private companies to decide whether to impose vaccine requirements.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 27
item.description: But here’s the funny part—Man Group trades crypto for its clients, because, hey, you can make money. (The Secret Life of Machines) Watch: Fax machines are more clever than you might think.

item.title: Checking in on the 'Jeopardy' Hosting Tryouts
item.description: Zoom out: Jeopardy!   When Burton made it known he really wanted the gig, fans started a petition that garnered over 250,000 signatures, which caught the eye of the show’s producers. The beloved actor LeVar Burton, known for his roles on Star Trek: The Next Generation, Roots, and Reading Rainbow, began his weeklong stint as guest host Jeopardy!
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Week Ahead: July 26
item.description: Economic data: GDP for the second quarter will drop on Thursday. Harry Potter turns 41 on Saturday.  Wanna feel old? So is Lollapalooza. It’s expected to show the US at peak growth—9.7%. Tune in Wednesday.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 26
item.description: American beach volleyball player Taylor Crabb described what it felt like to train for years to compete in the Olympics only to be quarantined in a Tokyo hotel room. (New York Times)
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Biden Assembles Antitrust A-Team
item.description: Facebook and Amazon have asked Khan to step back on any matters involving their companies, while Google could ask the same of Kanter. A favorite of progressives, he has criticized the current antitrust framework for years.
item.author: Neal Freyman
